projectDescription: Redesign the Water Institute website to comply with UNC's new university-wide brand architecture. This includes retiring the standalone Water Institute logo, implementing the new Gillings School signature system, updating typography to Open Sans, and integrating the UNC website toolbar and argyle graphic elements across all pages. As part of this project, we will migrate the site to a modern headless CMS architecture with a separate content database, enabling faster page loads, easier content editing, and more flexible future development.
estimatedTimeline: 4 weeks to meet the February 28, 2026 deadline. To hit this target, we need to kick off by the end of January 2026.
internalNotes: Rush job - UNC brand compliance required by Feb 28, 2026. Existing site built by Adrial Designs. Moving to Supabase + Sanity stack. 33 static pages + 14 CMS templates. ~1,000 CMS items to migrate. Reusing existing images/graphics. No monthly hosting fee in this estimate - they handle their own infrastructure.

phases.name: Brand Audit & Planning
phases.description: Comprehensive review of all 33 static pages and 14 CMS templates to map logo instances, typography usage, and graphic elements requiring updates. Document implementation roadmap aligned with UNC brand guidelines.

phases.name: Design System & Components
phases.description: Create new header component with UNC toolbar and typeset 'The Water Institute' text. Design updated footer with Gillings School signature. Establish Open Sans typography system and integrate argyle graphic elements per brand guidelines.

phases.name: Static Page Development
phases.description: Design and build all 33 static page layouts with new brand system. Optimize key pages for better usability, flow, and comprehension. Reorganize page layouts where needed to better accommodate information and user flow, particularly on the homepage and conference landing pages.

phases.name: CMS Templates & Database Migration
phases.description: Build all 14 CMS collection templates with new brand styling. Migrate approximately 1,000 content items (team profiles, projects, publications, events, knowledge articles, etc.) to the new content management system and database.

phases.name: Development & Integration
phases.description: Code implementation and technical build-out. Migrate site to a modern headless CMS with a separate content database, enabling faster page loads, easier content editing, and more flexible future updates. Update CSS for new typography and color treatments. Integrate new header/footer components across all pages.

phases.name: QA & Brand Compliance Review
phases.description: Cross-browser and device testing. Verify brand compliance against UNC guidelines across all pages. Migrate all existing 301 redirects and create new ones as needed to ensure old URLs forward correctly. Final review with client. Deploy to production.

## Brand Implementation Requirements

- **Logo:** Replace standalone Water Institute logo with Gillings School signature (interlocking NC + wordmark)
- **Unit Name:** "The Water Institute" typeset in Open Sans Bold, positioned per brand guidelines
- **Header:** Implement new UNC website toolbar with interlocking NC
- **Footer:** Gillings School or UNC signature
- **Typography:** Open Sans (Bold for headings, Regular for body)
- **Graphics:** Integrate argyle pattern elements where appropriate
- **Colors:** Maintain existing Carolina Blue, Navy palette
- **Images:** All existing photography and graphics from the current website will be reused
exclusions:
- Content creation or copywriting
- New photography or image sourcing (existing images will be reused)
- SEO optimization beyond existing setup
- Social media profile updates
- Print collateral design
- Ongoing maintenance after launch
- Additional revision rounds beyond two per phase
